{"step_by_step_thinking": "Perforation on the labial surface just above the CEJ during access opening of a maxillary incisor can occur due to the inability to assess the facial inclination of the crown to root. The labial surface is the outer surface of the tooth, and if the facial inclination of the crown to root is not properly assessed, it can lead to incorrect access opening and subsequent perforation.", "answer_choice": "B"}
